alert.note: Alert for Cullman (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 9:23PM CST until February 17 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Cullman County in north central Alabama... * Until 1230 AM CST. * At 923 PM CST, Emergency management reported heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring and water rescues are ongoing. Portions of I-65 are closed due to flooding in Cullman. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cullman, Hanceville, Good Hope, Holly Pond, Dodge City, Baldwin, Vinemont, Baileyton, Eva, Phelan, Joppa and Smith Lake. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
